column4: i'm having trouble preparing my partitions; I have about 10gb free but it's not letting me resize. it says fat32 partition.
what i'd do is use gparted.
how do i do that?
look in google for gparted,download live cd,burn it and make use of it ;)
thanks!
this tool is awesome,so far it managed to do everything that's physically possible with parition table ;d
I tried what you sad,d he problem was the same
And the problem was the same
what was the problem?
It won't let me resize my fat32 partition that I have winME on.
gparted was the same
ah damn,what error they output?
No error. All of the options to make the free space larger are greyed out.
what you mean? how you wanted to make it larger?
I wanted to make the fat32 partition smaller so I could install ubuntu
and resize doesn't work?
none of windows-native resizing tools work?
Didn't try them.
I didn't realise windows ME had one.
But somehow I doubt that
you may always download few ;)
gparted did not work, the installcd did not work... perhaps the problem is elsewhere than the software?
they are somewhat similar,try windows-based tools like partitionmagic
